name: Petroleum refining, at refinery
description: This module expresses data on the basis 1 kilogram of general refinery product as well as data allocated to specific refinery products. The data are allocated to specific refinery products based on the percent by mass of each product in the refinery output. Refinery products include gasoline, distillate/diesel oil, LPG, residual oil, kerosene/jet fuel, and other (still gas, petroleum, coke, asphalt, and petrochemical feedstocks).  Complete inventory data and metadata are available in full in the final report and appendices, Cradle-to-Gate Life Cycle Inventory of Nine Plastic Resins and Four Polyurethane Precursors. This report has been extensively reviewed within Franklin Associates and has undergone partial critical review by ACC Plastics Division members and is available at: www.americanchemistry.com. Quantities may vary slightly between the reference to main source and and this module due to rounding. Important note: although most of the data in the US LCI database has undergone some sort of review, the database as a whole has not yet undergone a formal validation process.  Please email comments to lci@nrel.gov.

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Desalting, atmospheric distillation, vacuum distillation, and hydrotreating
processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription: All information can be accessed by everybody.

exchanges.description: Mass (0.0451 kg/kg output) used for allocation. Conversion to volume used 1.356 m3/kg (from a density factor of 0.046 lb/ft3 for natural gas).

Represents transportation from site of crude oil extraction to petroleum refinery; Values for barge transport are calculated based on average fuel consumption rates as reported in Transportation Energy Data Book: Edition 22 from Oak Ridge National Laboratory, September 2002: 22% of barges use diesel fuel in their engines, 78% use residual oil to generate steam for steam turbines, and a barge that consumes residual oil consumes 3.4 gallons per 1,000 ton-miles

flow.name: Transport, barge, residual fuel oil powered

exchanges.description: Mass (0.0372 kg/kg output) used for allocation.
Mass (0.0489 kg/kg output) used for allocation. Conversion to volume used 1.059 L/kg (from 7.88 lb/gal as density factor).

Represents transportation from site of crude oil extraction to petroleum refinery; Values for ocean freighter transport are calculated based on average fuel consumption rates as determined from a personal communication with Rich Sonnenschein, U.S. Department of Transportation, Maritime Administration in February 2004: 10% of ocean freighters use diesel fuel, 90% use residual fuel, and a freighter that consumes residual fuel consumes 1.9 gallons per 1,000 ton-miles

categoryPath: 4831: Deep Sea, Coastal, and Great Lakes Water Transportation
